result.execSummary:
The defendant Deonjae V Boutwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.  Firearm prohibition warning given.
Consecutive to: to revocation now serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment, attend school full-time or engage in combination of employment and school equal to full-time hours.

Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Participate in counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations, including aftercare programming.  No contact with persons known to use, possess or sell controlled substances.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to revocation now serving.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Deonjae V Boutwell in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. Matter Adjourned.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 14, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
